item.description:
Jeff Rapsis has recently updated his blog with lots of information about this screening of The Phantom of the Opera. Visit www.silentfilmlivemusic.blogspot.com to get all the details.

This will make the third time that I have seen Jeff Rapsis compose music for a silent film as it rolls. He gives truly amazing and wonderful performances. He's accompanying several showings of The Phantom of the Opera around New England to coincide with Halloween. We'll be seeing an original 35mm print. Come see silent movies the way that they used to be shown to the public almost 100 years ago!

*****From the theater website: *****
Long before Andrew Lloyd Webber created the hit stage musical, this silent film adaptation starring Lon Chaney helped place The Phantom of the Opera firmly in the pantheon of both horror and romance. Shown in stunning tinted 35mm print that includes original technicolor sequences. Not to be missed!

*******************************

Tickets are $15.00 general admission and are already available at the box office between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m. You can also purchase tickets online at the theater's website.

I suggest buying your ticket in advance if you know that you don't want to miss this. I already have mine, and I purchased it from the theater box office just before posting this event.

I'll be carrying my red backpack and a meetup sign. I plan to be in the theater lobby by 1:15 p.m. At around 1:30 or so, I'll move into the theater auditorium so that we can sit smack in the middle and get good seats! You can find me there if you are late. The presentation starts at 2 p.m.

I'll wait in the theater lobby after the performance to gather everyone so we can trade notes about the movie and the music.

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my red backpack. I'll be carrying a meetup sign, too. See the event description for more details.
